intro: Caulinia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate caulinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
